output.answer:
Updating Your Contact Number

To update your contact number, here's what you need to do:

  1. Visit admin.microsoft.com and log in with your credentials.
  2. Navigate to the 'Authentication methods' section.
  3. Update your phone number with the new one you want to use.
  4. Cross-verify with yourself to ensure that the updated phone number is reflecting correctly on your profile.
  5. Once updated, you should be able to log in to the Student portal using your new phone number for verification processes.

If you need further assistance, please reach out to the IT Helpdesk support.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

output.answer:
MFA – Multi-Factor Authentication Setup

To set up the Microsoft Authenticator app for Multi-Factor Authentication, please follow these steps:

  1. Sign in to your work or school account on your computer.
  2. Once signed in, navigate to your security settings. You should see a page for setting up MFA.
  3. A page titled "Scan the QR code" will appear.
  4. Open the Microsoft Authenticator app on your mobile device.
  5. Use the app’s QR code reader to scan the QR code displayed on your computer screen.
  6. If the QR code reader can't read the code, select "Can't scan the QR code" and manually enter the provided code and URL into the app.
  7. After scanning, select "Next" on the computer screen. A notification will be sent to your mobile device.
  8. Approve the notification in the app.
  9. Your security info will be updated to use the Microsoft Authenticator app by default for verifying your identity during two-step verification or password reset.

If you encounter any issues or need further assistance, please contact our IT Helpdesk support.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

output.answer:
Assignment Submission Help

If you're experiencing issues with assignment submissions, here are steps you can follow for both Moodle and Blackboard:

Moodle

  • Log in to Moodle and navigate to the 'My Courses' section from the left-hand menu.
  • Select the appropriate course and open the specific unit where the assignment is located.
  • Scroll down to the Assignment link on the right side of the page.
  • In the submission area, choose 'Create Submission' or 'Upload File'.
  • Browse your local files (e.g., Downloads folder), attach the correct file, and click 'Submit'.
  • Ensure you've followed the instructor's guidelines for format and file size limits.

Blackboard

  • Log in to Blackboard and go to the 'Courses' section from the left-hand menu.
  • Select the course and open the unit containing the assignment.
  • Navigate to the Assignment link and select 'Create Submission' or 'Upload File'.
  • Attach your file by browsing local files, then click 'Submit'.
  • If it's a resubmission, ensure you've been granted access for a second attempt by the instructor.

Troubleshooting Tips

  • Ensure your file is saved correctly in File Explorer or OneDrive.
  • Check if the file is within the size limits and meets format requirements.
  • If experiencing difficulties, try creating assignments using Office 365 apps such as Word, PowerPoint, or Excel.
  • For tests or quiz issues, check browser compatibility, clear cache and cookies, disable pop-up blockers, and allow third-party cookies.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

output.answer:
Password Reset Options

If you need to reset your password, here are two methods you can follow:

Self Password Reset

  1. Open your browser and go to the Post University homepage.
  2. Click on “Student Login” located at the upper right corner of the page.
  3. Find the Student Portal Login icon and click on the appropriate “Login Now” icon.
  4. Enter your Student Email address.
  5. Click on the “Forgot my password” link.
  6. Enter the characters displayed in the picture or the words in the audio.
  7. Enter your phone number to receive a one-time password.
  8. Enter the verification code sent to your phone.
  9. Create and enter a new password to complete the reset.

Hard Password Reset

If the self-service reset is not successful, a hard reset may be necessary:

  • Contact support for assistance in performing a hard password reset.
  • They will generate a new, secure password for you.
  • Follow their guidance to update and secure your account with the new password.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support at 1.888.458.POST (7678).

Troubleshooting Portal Access Issues

If you're unable to access the Post University Portal, please follow these steps to resolve the issue:

  • Verify that you're using the correct portal URL: Post University Portal.
  • Ensure your login credentials (username and password) are entered correctly.
  • If you've forgotten your password, use the "Forgot my password" link on the login page to reset it.
  • Check your internet connection to confirm it is stable.
  • Clear your browser's cache and cookies, and then try to log in again.
  • Attempt to access the portal using a different web browser or device.

If these steps do not resolve your issue, please contact the IT Helpdesk for support at 1.888.458.POST (7678).

input.sys.query: how to clear chache and cookies

output.answer:
How to Clear Cache and Cookies

Clearing your cache and cookies can help resolve several issues. Here’s how you can do it on popular browsers:

Google Chrome
  1. Open Chrome and click on the three vertical dots in the top-right corner.
  2. Select More tools and then Clear browsing data.
  3. Choose a time range, like Last hour or All time for everything.
  4. Check the boxes next to Cookies and other site data and Cached images and files.
  5. Click Clear data.
Microsoft Edge
  1. Open Edge and click on the three horizontal dots in the top-right corner.
  2. Select Settings and scroll down to click on Privacy, search, and services.
  3. Under Clear browsing data, click Choose what to clear.
  4. Select a time range from the dropdown menu.
  5. Check Cookies and other site data and Cached images and files.
  6. Click Clear now.
Mozilla Firefox
  1. Open Firefox and click on the three horizontal lines in the top-right corner.
  2. Select Options.
  3. Go to the Privacy & Security panel.
  4. In the Cookies and Site Data section, click Clear Data….
  5. Check the boxes for Cookies and Site Data and Cached Web Content.
  6. Click Clear.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

output.answer:
Assignment Submission Help

If you're experiencing issues with assignment submissions, here are steps you can follow for both Moodle and Blackboard:

Moodle

  • Log in to Moodle and navigate to the 'My Courses' section from the left-hand menu.
  • Select the appropriate course and open the specific unit where the assignment is located.
  • Scroll down to the Assignment link on the right side of the page.
  • In the submission area, choose 'Create Submission' or 'Upload File'.
  • Browse your local files (e.g., Downloads folder), attach the correct file, and click 'Submit'.
  • Ensure you've followed the instructor's guidelines for format and file size limits.

Blackboard

  • Log in to Blackboard and go to the 'Courses' section from the left-hand menu.
  • Select the course and open the unit containing the assignment.
  • Navigate to the Assignment link and select 'Create Submission' or 'Upload File'.
  • Attach your file by browsing local files, then click 'Submit'.
  • If it's a resubmission, ensure you've been granted access for a second attempt by the instructor.

Troubleshooting Tips

  • Ensure your file is saved correctly in File Explorer or OneDrive.
  • Check if the file is within the size limits and meets format requirements.
  • If experiencing difficulties, try creating assignments using Office 365 apps such as Word, PowerPoint, or Excel.
  • For tests or quiz issues, check browser compatibility, clear cache and cookies, disable pop-up blockers, and allow third-party cookies.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

input.sys.query: Tell me about what is self reset?

output.answer:
Self Password Reset

If you need to reset your password yourself, you can use the following method:

  1. Open your browser and go to the Post University homepage.
  2. Click on “Student Login” located at the upper right corner of the page.
  3. Find the Student Portal Login icon and click on the appropriate “Login Now” icon.
  4. Enter your Student Email address.
  5. Click on the “Forgot my password” link.
  6. Enter the characters displayed in the picture or the words in the audio.
  7. Enter your phone number to receive a one-time password.
  8. Enter the verification code sent to your phone.
  9. Create and enter a new password to complete the reset.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

Assistance with Accessing E-Books

If you're having trouble accessing your e-books, please follow these steps:

  1. Verify Login Credentials: Ensure you are logged into Blackboard or Moodle with the correct credentials.
  2. Check the Virtual Library: Post University provides extensive online resources through its Virtual Library.
  3. Try a Different Browser or Device: Some resources may work better on certain browsers.
  4. Clear Cache and Cookies: This can resolve loading issues.
  5. Check Course Settings: Some materials may require instructor approval or specific access permissions.
  6. Look for Alternative Access: Some resources may be available through external links or databases.

Additional Steps for VitalSource E-Books:

  1. Visit the VitalSource website and log in using your student email address and password.
  2. If you've forgotten your password, use the "Forgot My Password" option and reset it through the verification email.
  3. Ensure the verification code is checked in your school Outlook email if not received immediately.
  4. If you don't have a VitalSource account, create one using your school email address.

If the problem persists, you can contact Post University Library Support for assistance with accessing resources. For any technical issues, feel free to contact Post University's IT Help Desk at 1.888.458.POST (7678).

output.answer:
Troubleshooting Blackboard Login Issues

If you're unable to login to Blackboard, please follow these steps to resolve the issue:

  1. Verify Credentials: Ensure that you are using the correct username and password.
  2. Reset Password: Use the “Forgot Password?” link on the Blackboard login page.
  3. Clear Browser Cache: Clear your cookies, cached images/files, and browsing history. Choose “All Time” or “Everything” as the time range and restart your browser afterwards.
  4. Switch or Update Browser: Use the latest version of Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox. If one browser fails, try the other.
  5. Disable Pop-Up Blockers: Make sure pop-ups are allowed, as Blackboard relies on them for key features.
  6. Close All Browser Tabs: If you are logged into Blackboard in multiple tabs, it can cause login issues. Close all tabs and restart the browser.
  7. Check Internet Connection: Ensure that you have a stable internet connection with at least 1.5 Mbps download speed.
  8. Enable Third-Party Cookies: This is especially important for tools like SafeAssign or embedded YouTube videos.

If these steps do not resolve your issue, it may be necessary to check the Blackboard status for any outages or maintenance. For further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support at 1.888.458.POST (7678).

output.answer:
Opciones para Restablecimiento de Contraseña

Si necesitas restablecer tu contraseña, aquí hay dos métodos que puedes seguir:

Restablecimiento de Contraseña por Auto-Servicio

  1. Abre tu navegador y ve a la página principal de Post University.
  2. Haz clic en “Student Login” ubicado en la esquina superior derecha de la página.
  3. Encuentra el ícono de Student Portal Login y haz clic en el ícono “Login Now” correspondiente.
  4. Ingresa tu dirección de correo electrónico de estudiante.
  5. Haz clic en el enlace “Forgot my password”.
  6. Ingresa los caracteres mostrados en la imagen o las palabras en el audio.
  7. Ingresa tu número de teléfono para recibir una contraseña de un solo uso.
  8. Introduce el código de verificación enviado a tu teléfono.
  9. Crea e ingresa una nueva contraseña para completar el restablecimiento.

Restablecimiento de Contraseña por Medio de Soporte

Si el restablecimiento por auto-servicio no es exitoso, puede ser necesario un restablecimiento completo:

  • Contacta al soporte para obtener ayuda en realizar un restablecimiento completo de contraseña.
  • Ellos generarán una nueva contraseña segura para ti.
  • Sigue sus instrucciones para actualizar y asegurar tu cuenta con la nueva contraseña.

Si necesitas más ayuda, por favor llama al soporte de la mesa de ayuda informática al 1.888.458.POST (7678).

input.sys.query: Tell me about what is moodle?

output.answer:
Moodle Overview

Moodle is an open-source Learning Management System (LMS) widely used for creating online educational websites and training programs. It provides educators with a flexible tool-set to support both blended learning and 100% online courses. Here's a quick rundown of its main features:

  • Course Management: Easily create and manage courses with extensive configuration options.
  • Interactive Activities: Incorporate quizzes, forums, databases, and surveys to engage learners.
  • Resource Sharing: Share documents, media, and links to ensure learners have easy access to all necessary materials.
  • Mobile Friendly: Access Moodle on various devices with its responsive design and mobile app.
  • Community Support: Benefit from a global support network of educators and developers.

For specific details on how Moodle is used at Post University or assistance with Moodle-related queries, you can refer to related Moodle documentation or reach out for support.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

input.sys.query: Cómo enviar una tarea en la plataforma LMS

output.answer:
Ayuda para el Envío de Tareas

Si estás experimentando problemas con el envío de tareas, aquí tienes los pasos que puedes seguir tanto para Moodle como para Blackboard:

Moodle

  1. Inicia sesión en Moodle y navega a la sección 'Mis Cursos' desde el menú de la izquierda.
  2. Selecciona el curso adecuado y abre la unidad específica donde se encuentra la tarea.
  3. Desplázate hacia abajo hasta el enlace de la tarea en el lado derecho de la página.
  4. En el área de envío, elige 'Crear Envío' o 'Subir Archivo'.
  5. Busca tus archivos locales (por ejemplo, la carpeta de Descargas), adjunta el archivo correcto y haz clic en 'Enviar'.
  6. Asegúrate de haber seguido las pautas del instructor para el formato y los límites de tamaño del archivo.

Blackboard

  1. Inicia sesión en Blackboard y ve a la sección 'Cursos' desde el menú de la izquierda.
  2. Selecciona el curso y abre la unidad que contiene la tarea.
  3. Navega al enlace de la tarea y selecciona 'Crear Envío' o 'Subir Archivo'.
  4. Adjunta tu archivo navegando en los archivos locales, luego haz clic en 'Enviar'.
  5. Si es un reenvío, asegúrate de que el instructor te haya otorgado acceso para un segundo intento.

Consejos para la Solución de Problemas

  • Asegúrate de que tu archivo esté guardado correctamente en el Explorador de Archivos o OneDrive.
  • Verifica si el archivo está dentro de los límites de tamaño y cumple con los requisitos de formato.
  • Si experimentas dificultades, intenta crear tareas usando aplicaciones de Office 365 como Word, PowerPoint o Excel.
  • Para problemas con pruebas o cuestionarios, verifica la compatibilidad del navegador, borra la caché y las cookies, desactiva los bloqueadores de ventanas emergentes y permite cookies de terceros.

Si necesitas más ayuda, por favor llama al soporte de la mesa de ayuda de TI al 1.888.458.POST (7678).

input.sys.query: How to submit assignment in Blackboard

output.answer:
Assignment Submission in Blackboard

To submit an assignment in Blackboard, please follow these steps:

  1. Log in to Blackboard and go to the 'Courses' section from the left-hand menu.
  2. Select the course and open the unit containing the assignment.
  3. Navigate to the Assignment link and select 'Create Submission' or 'Upload File'.
  4. Attach your file by browsing local files, then click 'Submit'.
  5. If it's a resubmission, ensure you've been granted access for a second attempt by the instructor.

Troubleshooting Tips

  • Ensure your file is saved correctly in File Explorer or OneDrive.
  • Check if the file is within the size limits and meets format requirements.
  • If experiencing difficulties, try creating assignments using Office 365 apps such as Word, PowerPoint, or Excel.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

output.answer:
Portal Login Information

To access the Post University portal, please follow these steps:

  • Visit the Post University homepage.
  • Click on “Student Login” at the upper right corner of the page.
  • Select the Student Portal Login icon and click on the appropriate “Login Now” button.
  • Enter your Student Email address and password to log in.

If you need to reset your password, you can use the "Forgot my password" option.

If you encounter any issues, feel free to contact IT Helpdesk support at 1.888.458.POST (7678).

output.answer:
Password Reset Options

If you need to reset your password, here are two methods you can follow:

Self Password Reset

  1. Open your browser and go to the Post University homepage.
  2. Click on “Student Login” located at the upper right corner of the page.
  3. Find the Student Portal Login icon and click on the appropriate “Login Now” icon.
  4. Enter your Student Email address.
  5. Click on the “Forgot my password” link.
  6. Enter the characters displayed in the picture or the words in the audio.
  7. Enter your phone number to receive a one-time password.
  8. Enter the verification code sent to your phone.
  9. Create and enter a new password to complete the reset.

Hard Password Reset

If the self-service reset is not successful, a hard reset may be necessary:

  • Contact support for assistance in performing a hard password reset.
  • They will generate a new, secure password for you.
  • Follow their guidance to update and secure your account with the new password.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

input.sys.query: Tell me about what is blackboard?

output.answer:
What is Blackboard?

Blackboard Learn is a widely used Learning Management System (LMS) designed to support online, hybrid, and face-to-face education. Developed by Blackboard Inc. (now part of Anthology), it provides a centralized platform for delivering and managing educational content, communication, and assessments. Blackboard offers various features to facilitate learning, including course management, customizable open architecture, and scalable design, which allows for integration with student information systems and authentication processes.

Moodle

  • Log in to your Moodle account.
  • Navigate to the course where you want to create the quiz.
  • Click on 'Turn editing on' at the top right corner.
  • In the section where you want the quiz, click on 'Add an activity or resource'.
  • Select 'Quiz' from the activities list and click 'Add'.
  • Fill in the necessary details such as Quiz name and description.
  • Adjust the quiz settings to suit your requirements, including timing, grade, layout, question behavior, and review options.
  • Click 'Save and display' to start adding questions.
  • Use the 'Edit quiz' option to add questions and set point values for each question.

Blackboard

  • Log in to your Blackboard account.
  • Go to the course where you want to create the quiz.
  • Under 'Course Management', click on 'Course Tools'.
  • Select 'Tests, Surveys, and Pools' then 'Tests'.
  • Click on 'Build Test' to create a new test.
  • Enter the test name, description, and instructions as needed.
  • Click 'Submit' and proceed to add questions.
  • Choose 'Create Question' to add new questions or 'Find Questions' to add existing ones from the question pool.
  • Set the point value for each question and organize them as needed.
  • Deploy the test in a content area by selecting 'Assessments' > 'Test', then choose your test.
  • Adjust availability, feedback, and presentation settings as necessary before making the quiz available to students.

Ensure you preview the quiz to check for any issues before making it live for students. If you need further guidance, please refer to the help documentation or resources provided by Moodle or Blackboard.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).

input.sys.query: Tell me about how to reset password?

output.answer:
Password Reset Options

If you need to reset your password, here are two methods you can follow:

Self Password Reset

  1. Open your browser and go to the Post University homepage.
  2. Click on “Student Login” located at the upper right corner of the page.
  3. Find the Student Portal Login icon and click on the appropriate “Login Now” icon.
  4. Enter your Student Email address.
  5. Click on the “Forgot my password” link.
  6. Enter the characters displayed in the picture or the words in the audio.
  7. Enter your phone number to receive a one-time password.
  8. Enter the verification code sent to your phone.
  9. Create and enter a new password to complete the reset.

Hard Password Reset

If the self-service reset is not successful, a hard reset may be necessary:

  • Contact support for assistance in performing a hard password reset.
  • They will generate a new, secure password for you.
  • Follow their guidance to update and secure your account with the new password.

If you need further assistance, please call IT Helpdesk support 1.888.458.POST (7678).
